intro: Tomostima cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tomostima, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Tomostima cuneifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
